# 333serverlist-menu  [![Python](https://img.shields.io/badge/Python-3776AB?logo=python&logoColor=fff)](#) [![Openbox](https://img.shields.io/badge/Openbox%20-%20%23353535?style=flat&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](https://openbox.org) [![Labwc](https://img.shields.io/badge/Labwc%20-%231e2835?style=flat&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](https://labwc.github.io)

A Python pipemenu for Openbox/Labwc that lists gameservers from 333networks (a gamespy clone) and shows the servers, along with the number of players in a game server.

# Usage
To use this script, edit the variable "gamename" within the .py code to query specific game servers (To see gamenames, please check out https://master.333networks.com/s and highlight the appropriate game icon). 
Then, add it as a pipe menu in the `menu.xml` of Openbox (`~/.config/openbox`) or Labwc (`~/.config/labwc`) with the following line: 

`<menu id="<anyid>" label="333Networks" execute="python <pathtothescript>/333serverlist-menu.py" />`


After this, simply highlight the entry inside the menu to load the serverlist.

Note: For the script to work on Labwc, the entry needs to be enclosed within `<menu id="root-menu"> </menu>` (assuming the menuid of the menu opened by clicking is "root-menu" inside rc.xml).

## Requirements
> Python - 3.10+

## Screenshots
Below example queries the server list for the game "Serious Sam: The Second Encounter":
